sen.j: 金鎖甲（きんさこう）という鎖を編んで作った鎧を着し、腕には海老籠手（えびごて）と呼ぶ防具を着け筒状の宝冠を被る。
sen.e: It puts on an amour knitted by chains, Kinsako (金鎖甲), and protective gears which are called Ebigote (海老籠手) in arms and a coronet on the head.

sen.j: 持物は左手に宝塔、右手に宝棒または戟で、見るからに異国風の像である。
sen.e: Its belongings are a pagoda in the left hand, a treasure club or ji in the right hand, which is visibly-exotic.

sen.e: In addition, it stands on Chitennyo and two devils (Niramba and Biramba) instead of Jaki.

sen.j: 東寺の兜跋毘沙門天像は、かつて羅城門の楼上に安置されていたという。
sen.e: It is said that Tobatsu Bishamonten in To-ji Temple (Kyoogokoku-ji Temple) was placed on Rajomon gate.

sen.j: 「兜跋」とは西域兜跋国、即ち現在のトゥルファンとする説が一般的で、ここに毘沙門天がこの姿で現れたという伝説に基づく。
sen.e: It is generally said that 'Tobatsu (兜跋)' means Western 兜跋 country, that is, Turfan at present, which is based on a legend that Bishamonten appeared in this place with this figure.

sen.j: 像容は、東寺像を忠実に模刻したもの（奈良国立博物館像、京都・清凉寺像など）と、地天女の両手の上に立つ以外は通例の毘沙門天像と変わらないもの（岩手・成島毘沙門堂像など）とがある。
sen.e: The figures of statue are clarified into two; the one which imitates the statue of To-ji Temple truly (the statue of Nara National Museum, the statue of Seiryo-ji Temple in Kyoto) and the other which is almost same as usual Bishamonten statue except standing on the both hands of Chitennyo (Narushima Bishamon-do in Iwate, and so on).
